name: COATESVILLE SCRAP IRON & METAL COMPANY, INC., Petitioner, v. E.B. AUTO WRECKING, INC. d/b/a E.B. Corp., Inc., and Ernest Barkman, Individually and d/b/a E.B. Sales, Respondents
name_abbreviation: Coatesville Scrap Iron & Metal Co. v. E.B. Auto Wrecking, Inc.
docket_number: Petitions Nos. 846 and 847 M.D. Alloc. Dkt. 1998

parties: COATESVILLE SCRAP IRON & METAL COMPANY, INC., Petitioner, v. E.B. AUTO WRECKING, INC. d/b/a E.B. Corp., Inc., and Ernest Barkman, Individually and d/b/a E.B. Sales, Respondents.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 25th day of February 1999, the Petitions for Allowance of Appeal are granted for review of the following issue: Whether delay damages under Pa.R.Civ.P. 238 are limited to tort actions.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Steven L. Smith, Philadelphia, for petitioner.
casebody.head_matter:
725 A.2d 1197
COATESVILLE SCRAP IRON & METAL COMPANY, INC., Petitioner, v. E.B. AUTO WRECKING, INC. d/b/a E.B. Corp., Inc., and Ernest Barkman, Individually and d/b/a E.B. Sales, Respondents.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Feb. 25, 1999.
Steven L. Smith, Philadelphia, for petitioner.
